overview.description: This assessment evaluates understanding of Amivero's AI capabilities, deployments, and solutions across federal agencies. Week 3 focuses on how Amivero implements transparent, ethical AI systems that support mission-critical operations while maintaining accountability and trust. Participants will demonstrate knowledge of specific AI platforms, frameworks, and real-world applications deployed by Amivero for agencies including DHS, USCIS, CBP, and ICE.
learningObjectives: Understand Amivero's mission and approach to AI solutions
Identify specific AI platforms and frameworks used by Amivero
Recognize key AI/ML technologies and their applications
Understand architectural approaches like RAG for federal AI systems
Learn about Amivero's solutions across different federal agencies
Recognize the importance of transparency and ethics in AI deployment
prerequisites: Week 1: Fundamentals of AI course material
Week 2: Bias and Responsible AI Use course material

options.label: B

questions.text: The CBP OCC Litigation LLM uses which core AI architectural approach?

options.label: A
options.reasoning: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) combines large language models with document retrieval systems to provide contextually accurate responses grounded in specific source materials. This approach is critical for legal and compliance applications where accuracy and source attribution are essential. RAG enables the LLM to access relevant legal documents and case files, ensuring responses are factually grounded and traceable to authoritative sources.

questions.text: What is Aether, one of Amivero's AI capabilities?

options.label: B
options.text: A graph database analytics framework for network analysis
options.reasoning: Aether is Amivero's graph database analytics framework designed for network analysis and relationship mapping. Graph databases excel at revealing complex relationships and patterns in interconnected data, making them valuable for intelligence analysis, threat detection missions, fraud detection, and understanding complex organizational or network structures. Unlike traditional relational databases, graph databases store relationships as first-class data structures, enabling efficient multi-hop traversals and pattern detection.

questions.text: ASAP addresses which key challenge facing government agencies in personnel security adjudications?

options.label: C
options.text: Insufficient budget allocation for technology upgrades

options.label: D
options.text: Fragmented legacy systems and manual document review processes
options.reasoning: The Automated Security Adjudication Platform (ASAP) addresses the critical challenge of fragmented legacy systems and time-consuming manual document review in personnel security clearance processes. By automating data aggregation and analysis across multiple disparate systems, ASAP accelerates adjudication timelines while maintaining security standards. This reduces the backlog of security clearance applications and improves the efficiency of the entire personnel security process.
